intro: Willoughbya vitifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed willoughbya, is a unique plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Willoughbya vitifolia is often found in wetland or riparian habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
